page.title: 15THE WORK OF THE LOCAL POLICE
page.content: We interviewed a local policeman whose base is Newmills Police Station. {This station covers the area from {Kincardine Bridge to Limekilns. There {are three men at Kincardine, one at {Culross, one at Charlestown and at {Newmills including the Sergeant there {are five men.}He normally works an eight hour shift although he can be called upon to work extra hours. He describes the area in which he works as a{cross-section of the {community.}Most people in Valleyfield} are{miners.}In Crombie most work in the{Ammunition Depot}and in Limekilns} and Chrlestown people mainly work in {offices and factories.}The crime rate in the area is average and the detection rate is 50%.Policemen in a country station have to do all their own paperwork. He enjoys working in this area very much.
